node.html: An AI-driven PvP storytelling experience that blends narrative generation and real-time competition. I architected the Go backend services, WebSocket infrastructure (Protobuf), Redis coordination layer, and LLM runtime that powers branching narratives, seasonal leaderboards, and gacha-based progression. The cross-platform Flutter client streams low-latency updates from Kubernetes pods deployed on GCP, supporting 100,000+ concurrent socket connections and 137+ daily active beta users.

Research tooling built for the UW–Madison Single Nucleus ATAC-Seq lab. I prototyped multiple algorithms to surface anomalies in cancer cell data, automated Docker-based pipelines to run sequences in parallel, and stitched aggregate insights across runs to guide lab scientists toward promising treatments.

Designed and implemented deployment pipelines for more than 10 microservices at Razorpay. Streamlined the CI/CD process, reducing deployment time and ensuring high availability for critical payment services.

Identified and resolved critical memory leaks in HP's core system services. Utilized advanced profiling tools to pinpoint resource drains, resulting in improved system stability and performance for millions of devices.

Developed SONAR, a real-time diagnostics tool for HP's cloud gaming platform. It monitors 1,000+ concurrent audio/video streams, detecting anomalies and latency issues to ensure a smooth gaming experience for users.

A decentralized platform for fractionalizing high-value NFTs into tradeable ERC-20 tokens. I developed the smart contracts for fractionalization and the frontend interface for users to mint, trade, and redeem their fragments.

Led the architecture and design of a complete end-to-end testing pipeline for the entire device chain at HP-Poly. Collaborated with 10+ engineers to automate testing across hardware and software layers, ensuring robust product quality.

Contributed to open-source machine learning libraries during GSoC 2021. Implemented advanced computer vision models and optimized training pipelines for edge devices, improving inference speed by 30%.
Built a labelling pipeline to process and label 1 million+ images per day. This automated system significantly accelerated the training data generation process for map feature recognition models.

Engineered an end-to-end machine learning pipeline for map data correction. The system automates data ingestion, model training, and deployment, significantly reducing the time required to update map features based on user feedback.
